ratings.comment: David is an excellent professor who makes very clear what will and will not be needed for the exam. I really enjoyed how clearly he explained things and how he included interesting and relevant examples. I found that it was easy (well, as easy as biochem can be) to succeed in his class and would certainly take him again.

Professor Pagliarini was an excellent lecturer who took the time to make the material clear and interesting. His expectations for the exams were laid out lecture by lecture in a study guide which made preparing for the exams quite simple. I found that his exam followed the study guide and was very straight forward. Would definitely take again.

Professor Pagliarini is my favorite professor in the department. He recognizes the material he teaches is difficult and truly cares that his students do well. He is very clear with what will and won't be tested on the exam. His lectures were interesting & he was friendly when asking questions. Its a shame he only taught 1/4 of the class.

He is a phenomenal teacher. It is unfortunate that he is so busy with his research that he can only teach 1/4 of the course. He is by far one of the greatest professors at the university. Super clear with his lectures. Gives very fair exams, and overall a very kind guy.  The other two biochem professors leave much to be desired

He is a great professor and has a way to get the best out of students.  Information in his section was much more applicable and not just memorizing random structures that will soon be forgotten.  Lectures are clear and concise.  He does a great job explaining information clearly.

Absolutely phenomenal. He made the information presented extremely clear and extremely interesting. He made a point to connect information to previous lectures to solidity material. I left each lecture with a complete understanding of the concepts; which is rare. He did a great job. The tests are very fair so it will clearly reflect if you studied

Just completely amazing. He makes the information really clear and takes it slow so that students really understand. He also connects information from previous lectures which really helps to solidify information. He did a phenomenal job of teaching! Also the frequent clicker questions make sure students understand the concepts. Awesome awesome.

Great professor! Compared to Nelson and Cox, his lecture slides are much more helpful and easy to understand. Does not give 60 slides per lecture with confusing chemical structures which is great. Exam is fair and so much related with the topic he covers in the lecture.

Not as good as Nelson or Cox, but teaches in a very similar style. Exams are fair, lectures are clear, and he has a solid understanding of many areas of biochemistry. A solid professor and a nice addition to the Biochem Faculty at Madison.
